summary.name: summary
summary.value: Invalid complex type handling in strategy ArrayOfTypeComplex

description.name: description
description.value:
This is similar issue like this http://framework.zend.com/issues/browse/ZF-5430 but with ArrayOfTypeComplex strategy.

This files:
{code:title=service.php|borderStyle=solid}
require_once 'Zend/Loader.php';
require_once './My_Service.class.php';
Zend_Loader::registerAutoload();
$autodiscover = new Zend_Soap_AutoDiscover('Zend_Soap_Wsdl_Strategy_ArrayOfTypeComplex');
$autodiscover->setClass('My_Service');
$autodiscover->handle();
{code} 
{code:title=My_Service.class.php|borderStyle=solid}
<?php
class My_Service
{
	/**
	*	@param string $foo	 
	*	@return My_Response[]
	*/
	public function foo($foo)
	{	    
	   // code	
	}
	
	/**
	*	@param string $bar
	*	@return My_Response[]
	*/
	public function bar($bar)
	{	    
	   // code	
	}
	
	/**
	*	@param string $baz
	*	@return My_Response[]
	*/
	public function baz($baz)
	{	    
	   // code	
	}
}

class My_Response
{
	/**
	*	@var string
	*/
	public $p1;
}
{code} 
generates this invalid wsdl:
{code:xml|title=invalid.wsdl|borderStyle=solid}
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<definitions xmlns="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/" xmlns:tns="http://example.com/service.php" xmlns:soap="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/soap/" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:soap-enc="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/" xmlns:wsdl="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/" name="My_Service" targetNamespace="http://example.com/service.php">
	<portType name="My_ServicePort">
		<operation name="foo">
			<input message="tns:fooRequest"/>
			<output message="tns:fooResponse"/>
		</operation>
		<operation name="bar">
			<input message="tns:barRequest"/>
			<output message="tns:barResponse"/>
		</operation>
		<operation name="baz">
			<input message="tns:bazRequest"/>
			<output message="tns:bazResponse"/>
		</operation>
	</portType>
	<binding name="My_ServiceBinding" type="tns:My_ServicePort">
		<soap:binding style="rpc" transport="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/http"/>
		<operation name="foo">
			<soap:operation soapAction="http://example.com/service.php#foo"/>
			<input>
				<soap:body use="encoded" encodingStyle="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/"/>
			</input>
			<output>
				<soap:body use="encoded" encodingStyle="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/"/>
			</output>
		</operation>
		<operation name="bar">
			<soap:operation soapAction="http://example.com/service.php#bar"/>
			<input>
				<soap:body use="encoded" encodingStyle="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/"/>
			</input>
			<output>
				<soap:body use="encoded" encodingStyle="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/"/>
			</output>
		</operation>
		<operation name="baz">
			<soap:operation soapAction="http://example.com/service.php#baz"/>
			<input>
				<soap:body use="encoded" encodingStyle="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/"/>
			</input>
			<output>
				<soap:body use="encoded" encodingStyle="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/"/>
			</output>
		</operation>
	</binding>
	<service name="My_ServiceService">
		<port name="My_ServicePort" binding="tns:My_ServiceBinding">
			<soap:address location="http://example.com/service.php"/>
		</port>
	</service>
	<message name="fooRequest">
		<part name="foo" type="xsd:string"/>
	</message>
	<types>
		<xsd:schema targetNamespace="http://example.com/service.php">
			<xsd:complexType name="ArrayOfMy_Response">
				<xsd:complexContent>
					<xsd:restriction base="soap-enc:Array">
						<xsd:attribute ref="soap-enc:arrayType" wsdl:arrayType="tns:My_Response[]"/>
					</xsd:restriction>
				</xsd:complexContent>
			</xsd:complexType>
			<xsd:complexType name="My_Response">
				<xsd:all>
					<xsd:element name="p1" type="xsd:string"/>
				</xsd:all>
			</xsd:complexType>
		</xsd:schema>
	</types>
	<message name="fooResponse">
		<part name="fooReturn" type="tns:ArrayOfMy_Response"/>
	</message>
	<message name="barRequest">
		<part name="bar" type="xsd:string"/>
	</message>
	<message name="barResponse">
		<part name="barReturn" type="tns:My_Response[]"/>
	</message>
	<message name="bazRequest">
		<part name="baz" type="xsd:string"/>
	</message>
	<message name="bazResponse">
		<part name="bazReturn" type="tns:My_Response[]"/>
	</message>
</definitions>
{code} 
and it should generate wsdl like this:
{code:xml|title=valid.wsdl|borderStyle=solid}
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<definitions xmlns="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/" xmlns:tns="http://example.com/service.php" xmlns:soap="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/soap/" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:soap-enc="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/" xmlns:wsdl="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/" name="My_Service" targetNamespace="http://example.com/service.php">
	<portType name="My_ServicePort">
		<operation name="foo">
			<input message="tns:fooRequest"/>
			<output message="tns:fooResponse"/>
		</operation>
		<operation name="bar">
			<input message="tns:barRequest"/>
			<output message="tns:barResponse"/>
		</operation>
		<operation name="baz">
			<input message="tns:bazRequest"/>
			<output message="tns:bazResponse"/>
		</operation>
	</portType>
	<binding name="My_ServiceBinding" type="tns:My_ServicePort">
		<soap:binding style="rpc" transport="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/http"/>
		<operation name="foo">
			<soap:operation soapAction="http://example.com/service.php#foo"/>
			<input>
				<soap:body use="encoded" encodingStyle="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/"/>
			</input>
			<output>
				<soap:body use="encoded" encodingStyle="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/"/>
			</output>
		</operation>
		<operation name="bar">
			<soap:operation soapAction="http://example.com/service.php#bar"/>
			<input>
				<soap:body use="encoded" encodingStyle="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/"/>
			</input>
			<output>
				<soap:body use="encoded" encodingStyle="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/"/>
			</output>
		</operation>
		<operation name="baz">
			<soap:operation soapAction="http://example.com/service.php#baz"/>
			<input>
				<soap:body use="encoded" encodingStyle="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/"/>
			</input>
			<output>
				<soap:body use="encoded" encodingStyle="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/"/>
			</output>
		</operation>
	</binding>
	<service name="My_ServiceService">
		<port name="My_ServicePort" binding="tns:My_ServiceBinding">
			<soap:address location="http://example.com/service.php"/>
		</port>
	</service>
	<message name="fooRequest">
		<part name="foo" type="xsd:string"/>
	</message>
	<types>
		<xsd:schema targetNamespace="http://example.com/service.php">
			<xsd:complexType name="ArrayOfMy_Response">
				<xsd:complexContent>
					<xsd:restriction base="soap-enc:Array">
						<xsd:attribute ref="soap-enc:arrayType" wsdl:arrayType="tns:My_Response[]"/>
					</xsd:restriction>
				</xsd:complexContent>
			</xsd:complexType>
			<xsd:complexType name="My_Response">
				<xsd:all>
					<xsd:element name="p1" type="xsd:string"/>
				</xsd:all>
			</xsd:complexType>
		</xsd:schema>
	</types>
	<message name="fooResponse">
		<part name="fooReturn" type="tns:ArrayOfMy_Response"/>
	</message>
	<message name="barRequest">
		<part name="bar" type="xsd:string"/>
	</message>
	<message name="barResponse">
		<part name="barReturn" type="tns:ArrayOfMy_Response"/>
	</message>
	<message name="bazRequest">
		<part name="baz" type="xsd:string"/>
	</message>
	<message name="bazResponse">
		<part name="bazReturn" type="tns:ArrayOfMy_Response"/>
	</message>
</definitions>
{code} 

h3.Summary:
Type of response message should be "ArrayOfMy_Response" not "My_Response[]"

Valid:
{code:xml|borderStyle=solid}
<message name="bazResponse">
	<part name="bazReturn" type="tns:ArrayOfMy_Response"/>
</message>
{code}

Invalid:
{code:xml|borderStyle=solid}
<message name="bazResponse">
	<part name="bazReturn" type="tns:My_Response[]"/>
</message>
{code}

Solution proposed by Christian Münch in http://framework.zend.com/issues/browse/ZF-5430
{code:title=Zend/Soap/Wsdl/Strategy/ArrayOfTypeComplex.php|borderStyle=solid}
91:	$this->getContext()->addType($type);
{code}
changed to:
{code:title=Zend/Soap/Wsdl/Strategy/ArrayOfTypeComplex.php|borderStyle=solid}
91:	$this->getContext()->addType($complexTypeName);
{code}
solves this issue but duplicates complex type definition in wsdl file.
For example:
{code:xml|borderStyle=solid}
<xsd:complexType name="ArrayOfMy_Response">
	<xsd:complexContent>
		<xsd:restriction base="soap-enc:Array">
			<xsd:attribute ref="soap-enc:arrayType" wsdl:arrayType="tns:My_Response[]"/>
		</xsd:restriction>
	</xsd:complexContent>
</xsd:complexType>
<xsd:complexType name="ArrayOfMy_Response">
	<xsd:complexContent>
		<xsd:restriction base="soap-enc:Array">
			<xsd:attribute ref="soap-enc:arrayType" wsdl:arrayType="tns:My_Response[]"/>
		</xsd:restriction>
	</xsd:complexContent>
</xsd:complexType>
{code}

My temporary solution:
{code:title=Zend/Soap/Wsdl.php|borderStyle=solid}
472:	public function toXML()
473:	{
474:		return preg_replace('/(?<=\s)type\=\"tns\:([a-zA-Z_]+)\[\]/', 'type="tns:ArrayOf\1', $this->_dom->saveXML());
475:	       // return $this->_dom->saveXML();
476:	}
{code}

value.name: Zend_Soap_Wsdl
value.description: Class for accessing SOAP WSDL documents.

value.body: Fixed in trunk, will be in next minor version 1.8 - Can you please test the functionality?
